channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Previous report not fully fixed., 21st October
item.description:
I previously reported overgrown vegetation to the public footpath between Hunters Road and Stoke Road. This has been reported as fixed (ref 11379330) but, as the photo shows, there is a substantial layer of ivy covering the still covering the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 19 Hunters Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potentially dangerous wobbly paving stone, 21st October
item.description:
There are a series of cracked paving stones on the pedestrianised area of The Promenade outside House of Fraser but whilst the council appear to have highlighted one broken slab, its the neighbouring one - that is very wobbly and sticking up - which is potentially dangerous. I have enclosed the window from HOF for reference and proximity

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 48a Regent Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Ineffective temporary traffic lights, 20th October

item.title: Antique bollard placement - obstruction, 20th October
item.description:
The resident of the house by this bollard is having persistent problems with other people worried about banging their car doors on the bollard when they park, so they park across their driveway or in disabled spaces. The bollard is solid cast iron so a bit of an obstacle, plus it tends to cause people pushing prams or using wheelchairs into the road as pavement width isn't sufficient to accommodate them. Would it be at all possible to relocate this specific bollard and potentially some of the others also causing obstruction? They're heritage so not appropriate to discard but could be used elsewhere in the ward where they wouldn't cause parking or pedestrian issues. Thanks so much!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34 Marle Hill Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard, 20th October
item.description:
This is at the corner of the toddlers' play area. It appears that some grass reinforcement mesh has come above ground level, resulting in a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Hudson Street, Cheltenham

item.title: Missing grating/cover = pedestrian hazard, 19th October
item.description:
There's a missing cover on a round inspection hole in the pavement which is quite deep and a trip/fall hazard. Someone could easily break a leg in the dark!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34 Stoke Road, Bishops Cleeve

item.title: Redundant roadworks signs, 19th October
item.description:
A number of redundant roadworks and 40mph signs have been left on the road from just before Dunkertons to after the reservoir. They are causing people to drive too slowly for no reason (I am not one, I ignore them) There is no reason for them to be here and they need to be removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): London Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged tree, 19th October
item.description:
Queens Road, adjacent to entrance into Queens Court. Pavement tree, hit by vehicle in August. Tree now leaning over, roots ripped out of pavement, appears to be dying / already dead. Red plastic barriers were put around the tree a few weeks after the incident, but nothing more seems to be happening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 54 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned cones, barriers, signs, 19th October
item.description:
A40 Lansdown Road, next to railway bridge parapet within e-scooter station (close to pedestrian crossing). 2 large traffic cones, 4 plastic barriers, parking suspension sign. Been there for months, seemingly forgotten / abandoned / dumped. All needs clearing away.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 90 Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass, human excrement, blocked drainage, no lights, 18th October
item.description:
Glass multiple days every week I use the underpass new broken glass, urine stains, urine smell human poo on the path! Drug baggies - today 1 on the floor Lights not working/very dull Blocked drain This is used by all the community kids going to school - it is dangerous discusting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
